channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Who are the key players fighting in Syria’s civil war?
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands

item.title: Live briefing: Rebels advance in Syria; UNRWA pauses Gaza aid at key crossing
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The rebel offensive in Syria started after Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a cease-fire in Lebanon, where conflict has weakened key backers of Syria’s government.

item.title: U.N. agency suspends aid deliveries from key crossing after convoy attacks
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Claire Parker

item.title: Who are the key players fighting in Syria’s civil war?
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: Islamist rebel group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham launched a lightning assault against pro-Assad forces in Aleppo. Here’s who else is fighting in Syria’s civil war.

item.title: U.S. hostage in Gaza was killed on Oct. 7, 2023, IDF says
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Joanna Slater, Lior Soroka

item.title: At least 56 killed in stampede at soccer match in Guinea, officials say
item.dc:creator: Cindy Boren
item.description: An unknown number of others in the country’s largest southern city were injured when security tried to stop clashes over a disputed penalty,

item.title: Soup kitchen chef in Gaza killed by Israeli drone, family and witness say
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger

item.title: From beer to barley: How Trump’s tariff threat could affect your wallet
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Valentina Muñoz Castillo
item.description: Donald Trump’s threat to hit Mexico with tariffs could raise prices on a surprising number of foods and drinks Americans love — from beer to berries to broccoli.

item.title: What led to Syria’s 13-year civil war, and why has fighting surged again?
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Kelsey Baker

item.title: Biden surges arms to Ukraine, fearing Trump will halt U.S. aid
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan, Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Biden’s Ukraine directive has stirred debate, as some officials worry it will cut too deeply into American stockpiles and jeopardize military needs elsewhere.

item.title: Syrian rebels regrouped, seized on weakness of government’s key allies
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Kareem Fahim, Susannah George

item.title: What’s happening in Georgia, and why are thousands protesting?
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho
item.description: More than 200 were arrested and dozens injured during protests after Georgia’s ruling party said it would suspend talks to join the European Union.

item.title: Syrian government and rebels both make claims of advances
item.dc:creator: Meg Kelly, Kyle Rempfer

item.title: Syrian rebels wrest control of most of Aleppo; U.S. and allies ‘urge de-escalation’ in joint statement
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit, Mohamad El Chamaa, Maham Javaid, Praveena Somasundaram
item.description: The offensive, led by rebel group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, shifts the front lines of Syria’s civil war. Government forces appeared to withdraw from some areas.

item.title: What led to Syria’s 13-year civil war, and why has fighting surged again?
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Kelsey Baker

item.title: Assad’s allies show support for Syrian regime; U.S. conflicted by surge, Sullivan says
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Maham Javaid, Praveena Somasundaram

item.title: Rebels are roaming the streets of Aleppo, residents say
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Meg Kelly, Praveena Somasundaram

item.title: In Syria, a sudden reminder of a war that never ended
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The dramatic unraveling of the past days might show how hollow Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s supremacy was.

item.title: What led to Syria’s 13-year civil war, and why has fighting surged again?
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Kelsey Baker
item.description: The sudden assault by Syrian rebels has rapidly redrawn the civil war’s front lines and threatened once again the authority of President Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: Divided over whether to stop making plastic, U.N. treaty talks collapse
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: Delegates from more than 170 countries huddled for a week of marathon negotiations but came up short on delivering a treaty.

item.title: Iranian envoy meets with Assad to reassure ‘friends in hard times’
item.dc:creator: Susannah George

item.title: Syrian rebels regrouped, seized on weakness of government’s key allies
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Kareem Fahim, Susannah George
item.description: The rebels have made stunning gains against President Bashar al-Assad’s forces, with Russia, Iran and Hezbollah distracted by other conflicts.

item.title: Trump win emboldens Israeli settlers seeking control of the West Bank
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Adam Taylor
item.description: Israel’s extremist settlers see few barriers to their plans to rule the West Bank now that Trump is returning to the White House.

item.title: Syria rebels regrouped, seized on weakness of government’s key allies
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Kareem Fahim, Susannah George

item.title: Inside the effort to market Russia and Putin to Africans
item.dc:creator: Rachel Chason
item.description: The Africa Initiative is part of an opaque network of groups that Western officials and analysts say the Kremlin uses to spread Russian influence in Africa.

item.title: Syrian rebels defend gains in Aleppo, push south
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Meg Kelly

item.title: In silence and bluster, a shadow Trump foreign policy haunts Biden’s final acts
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung
item.description: While Biden attempts to lock in policy priorities with partners, Mar-a-Lago is becoming a magnet for foreign leaders eager to win Trump’s good graces.

item.title: Syrian rebels defend gains in Aleppo, push south
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Meg Kelly
item.description: The insurgent offensive, shocking for its speed, has posed the most serious challenge to President Bashar al-Assad in years.

item.title: Trump threatens tariffs on BRICS nations, demanding they use dollar
item.dc:creator: Maegan Vazquez, Gerrit De Vynck, David J. Lynch
item.description: The move comes after Canada’s prime minister rushed to Mar-a-Lago to dine with the president-elect to dissuade him over another big tariff threat.

item.title: See the scale of destruction in Hezbollah’s stronghold near Beirut
item.dc:creator: Ed Ram
item.description: Dozens of buildings lie in ruins along the street known as Hadi Nasrallah, a road that cuts through the Beirut suburb of Dahiyeh, a Hezbollah stronghold.

item.title: Israeli strikes continue amid cease-fire deal with Hezbollah
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The IDF said it conducted a strike on military infrastructure sites near the border crossings between Lebanon and Syria, calling it a response to cease-fire violations.

item.title: IDF strikes aid workers, says one was involved in Oct. 7 attack
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
